name: "They Call Us Babes in Arms" Quiz / Test | Musicals | 20 Questions

questions.text: What composing and lyricist team wrote this musical?
questions.explanation:
Rodgers and Hart.

	"Babes in Arms" first opened on April 14, 1937. It was redone in the 1950's with the version that is usually done on stage now, as the show takes place in the 1950's.

questions.text: Compete the lyrics from the title song: "They call us babes in arms, but we are babes in ____________."
questions.explanation:
armour.

	Val is the lead singer in this ensemble number. The kids in the show all want to be taken seriously as actors, but they are seen as just "babes in arms".

questions.text: What is the name of the play that Lee Calhoun wrote, directed and stars in?
questions.explanation:
The Deep North.

	Lee Calhoun is a southerner who hates the north.

questions.text: How does Gus know who Lee is when he first sees him?
options: He didn't know who Lee was
questions.explanation:
He heard his accent.

	Lee: "Did you see my picture?" Gus: "No I heard your accent." Lee: "Come down here and say that again." Gus: (coming down off ladder) "I heard your accent." Lee: "You can go back up now."  Lee is my favorite character in the show. He tries to act like a big tough southerner who hates the north, but he's nothing more than a cocky little man.

questions.text: Complete the lyric: "I miss the kisses and I miss the __________."
questions.explanation:
bites.

	This song is song by Terry and Gus. They are the on again, off again couple.  They seem to be happier together and fighting, than when they are not together.

questions.text: Complete the lyric: "And so it seems that we have met before, and laughed before, and loved before, but who knows __________________."
questions.explanation:
where or when.

	This song was song by Val and Jennifer when they first meet each other.

questions.text: Where does Bunny come from?
questions.explanation:
New York.

	They tell her she can't be a western singer becuase she's from New York.

questions.text: Complete the lyrics: "Where seldom is heard an _______________ word."
questions.explanation:
intelligent.

	This comes from "Way Out West On West End Avenue."

questions.text: Who sings the song "My Funny Valentine"?
questions.explanation:
Suzie.

	Suzie is head over heels in love with Val, but Val is interested in Jennifer Owens.

questions.text: What does Terry say she'll sell to become rich?
questions.explanation:
Her body.

	This is in the beginning of Act II. All the apprentices have given up hope of ever making it as actors.

questions.text: Complete this line by Terry when Suzie sings to them to "Imagine". "Then you must be ______, my pet."
questions.explanation:
nuts.

	Suzie is trying to cheer them all up by having them imagine there lives how they want it.

questions.text: Complete the lyric from "The Lady is a Tramp." "I get too hungry for dinner at eight, I like the theatre but never come late,  I never bother with people I ________!"
questions.explanation:
hate.

	Bunny sings "The Lady is a Tramp."

questions.text: Why does Lee think that Steve Edwards is " a man with no taste, intelligence ability or discrimination"?
options: He heard bad things about Steve from Jennifer
questions.explanation:
Steve turned down Lee's play.

	Lee thinks he is the greatest thing since sliced bread. Anyone who doesn't agree, especially a northerner, is simply no good and unworthy of his respect.

questions.text: Who is Suzie quite obviously in love with?
questions.explanation:
Valentine & Val.

	They do get together by the end of the show.

questions.text: Who is Suzie's brother?
questions.explanation:
Steve.

	No one believes Suzie when she says Steve is her brother. They all think she and Steve are lovers.

questions.text: Complete this line spoken by Lee: "That's enough. Ah am going back South. And ah will never come North again except as the head of a ______________________.
questions.explanation:
Confederate Army.

	The plan worked, they sabotaged Lee's play and he had left. This means Steve has time to see Val's play because "The Deep North" won't be running anymore.

questions.text: Okay, what answer do the children give to the following question: "Do you want to hear the story about Little Miss Muffet and the white slaver?"
questions.explanation:
No.

	This is part of Val's play that they are showing for Steve Edwards.

questions.text: What does Peter reply to the question: "Well, how about how Mother Goose got her name?"
questions.correct: We want to hear a clean story.
options: No thank you, I'd rather see the movie
questions.explanation:
We want to hear a clean story.

	Peter apparently gets the references, even though he is just a kid.

questions.text: Complete the lyric: "Poor Johnny One-Note, got in _______."
questions.explanation:
Aida.

	Johnny was forced to sing only one note because of a curse put on him by a soprano's fairy godmother.

questions.text: The last line in the show is "You see? A musical comedy can have a happy ending." Who says this line?
questions.explanation:
Press Agent.

	Steve liked the show and gave Val a check. Suzie got Val, Steve has Jennifer, Lee is gone. Everything worked out for the best.
